title: What’s Happening in Space Policy October 8-14, 2023
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of October 8-14, 2023 and any insight we can offer about them. The Senate is in recess except for […]

title: Head of ‘disruptive’ space procurement agency hits back at critics: ‘Change is hard’
summary: The head of the Space Development Agency is pushing back at critics who presumably don’t want the military acquisition culture to change, SDA’s director Derek Tournear said in a social media post.

title: KSC Flyover: SLC-40 crew tower rising, Roberts Road expansion detailed
summary:
Florida’s Space Coast has been awash with launch activity as of late, thanks in large part to the ever-increasing cadence that SpaceX is fostering. Even with this, several facilities in and around the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS) and NASA’s Kennedy Space Center (KSC) have seen a pulse of activity in recent days, with SpaceX and Blue Origin in particular taking steps to either bolster their existing infrastructure or prepare for future hardware testing.
Blue Origin — Exploration Park

title: PLD Space launches first suborbital rocket
summary: Spanish company PLD Space launched its first suborbital rocket Oct. 6, with the company calling the flight a success despite reaching a lower altitude than planned.

title: Russia Traces Luna-25 Crash to Onboard Control System Failure
summary: Russia’s state space corporation Roscosmos has concluded that Luna-25 failed because the onboard control system did not receive required data from the accelerometer to trigger an engine shutdown at the […]

title: ULA Atlas 5 launches first Project Kuiper satellites
summary: United Launch Alliance launched two prototypes Oct. 6 for the more than 3,200 Project Kuiper broadband satellites Amazon plans to build and deploy over the next six years.

title: Virgin Galactic performs fourth commercial suborbital flight
summary: Virgin Galactic continued its monthly cadence of commercial suborbital spaceflights Oct. 6, carrying three customers that included the first person from Pakistan to go to space.

title: Slingshot Aerospace harnessing AI to track suspicious satellites
summary: Slingshot Aerospace unveiled data that shows Russia’s new spy satellite Luch-2 is conducting operations akin to those of its predecessor Luch-1

title: Amazon launches first internet satellite prototypes
summary: Your Amazon order of internet satellite prototypes have shipped.

title: Northrop and Voyager emphasize benefits of commercial space station partnership
summary: Northrop Grumman and Voyager Space executives said their decision to work together on a commercial space station project, rather than pursue competing efforts, is a natural progression for an emerging industry.
